item.title: Report E-2024080701
item.description:
Report E-2024080701

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 16, 2024, ten (10) 1-gallon pails of contact cement were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the contact cement-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and ten (10) 1-gallon pails of contact cement were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080639
item.description:
Report E-2024080639

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 15, 2024. four (4) 1-gallon containers of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel collected four (4) damaged 1-gallon containers of paint and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. All paint (UN1263) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon container

item.title: Report E-2024080666
item.description:
Report E-2024080666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LGT. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC personnel neutralized the area, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged bottles and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization

item.title: Report E-2024080660
item.description:
Report E-2024080660

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20-gallons of service pro-non-chlorinated brake cleaner released from one 55-gallon metal drum. the release impacted the concrete dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and the caller determined that terminal staff were capable of cleaning the release with the available PPE on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024080661
item.description:
Report E-2024080661

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release. ERTS dispatched E3 Environmental to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the packaging and products and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released. E3 Environmental personnel moved all the products from the pallet, used soda ash and water to neutralize the impacted areas, and then cleaned the released material. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum and the recovered material was placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024080596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia field crew returned to Veolia's 10-day intransit facility in Arlington, TX with a 5-gallon pail from our client at UT Southwestern. During the loading process at the Veolia facility, an employee observed that the bucket's lid was not securely fastened, resulting in a leak. The spill was promptly identified, contained, and cleaned up, with immediate reporting of the incident. No injuries were reported.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Southwest Airlines Co
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Crewmember was sitting in a seat charging his cell phone using a battery pack. The crewrnember said that he noticed that the battery pack started swelling then there were sparks and flames. The crewmember threw the pack into the seat next to him. The other crewmembers used the fire extinguisher to put out the flames. There were 12 thru passengers on the flight that were instructed to deplane. Maintenance came on and replaced the seat.

item.title: Report X-2024081504
item.description:
Report X-2024081504

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The package smelled similar to formaldehyde. 1 bottle broken and assumed to be UN2920 Class 8(3). The SDS sheets were inside of the fiberboard box. Inner contents: 6 glass bottles, 6 small plastic bottles (black tape around lid), 3 Plastic Jugs. 9 L total shipped, wrapped in bubblewrap 2 Glass bottles 500ml XTQ017 – UN2920, PGI, 1 broken bottle 2 Glass bottles 500ml each,VBU792 – UN1993 PGII, 2 Glass bottles 500ml each TPL448-UN1993, PGII 2 plastic bottles 500ml each LPQ250 – UN1993 PGIII, 2 plastic bottles NEV805 – UN1993 PGIII, 2 plastic bottles BMW439 - Not Regulated 1 plastic bottle each 1L (CPL830 – UN1993 PGIII), (JTU721 – UN1993 PGIII), (HTY356 - Not Regulated). All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024080580
item.description:
Report E-2024080580

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the transfer of a 551A1 container filled with liquid, oil-based white paint (overpacked into an 851H2) from the customer's storage facility to a Veolia box truck, an incident occurred. As the drum, weighing over 600 pounds, was being positioned onto a pallet inside the Veolia box truck, a leak was detected. To prevent the drum from slipping and potentially injuring personnel, it was promptly secured on the pallet. However, approximately one gallon of the waste material escaped from the drum, contaminating both the pallet and the box truck's floor. The cause of the leak remains unclear, as the drum's position did not seem to be a contributing factor. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the inner container was missing its bung, which may have played a role in the unexpected release of the waste material.

item.title: Report E-2024080579
item.description:
Report E-2024080579

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: AMARILLO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Lone Star Hazmat Response was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that twelve (12) ounces of material were released due to the tote being punctured by the cage. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel transferred the remaining material into a new tote, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-cup of Klean Strip Acetone released from a metal pail due to forklift incident. The release impacted the pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel who felt capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on site.
